title: Macron tells party leaders  France's support to Ukraine has 'no limits'
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron met with leaders of the opposition to discuss the war in Ukraine. He has suggested that Ukraine's allies should not rule out sending troops.

title: Paris Stock Exchange's CAC 40 index topped 8,000 points, a record high
summary: Following in the wake of Wall Street, the index benefits from the prospects of interest rate cuts and positive corporate earnings. The upward trend is increasingly concentrated on a small number of stocks.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Pretoria filed an urgent request to the International Court of Justice in reaction to first signs of famine in Gaza
summary: South Africa is asking the judges in The Hague to order Israel and Hamas to stop fighting. In an initial decision handed down at the end of January, the ICJ simply ordered Israel not to commit genocidal acts.

title: In Haiti, 'gangs have transformed their territorial control into social, economic and military domination'
summary: Political scientist Romain Le Cour Grandmaison provided insights into the new outbreak of violence that has set Haiti's heavily gang-controlled territory ablaze.

title: Eurovision accepts Israeli entry after lyrics edit
summary: Israel in 1973 became the first non-European country to enter Eurovision, and its participation and hosting of the event have regularly run into controversy.

title: The mystery of how cocoa spread across South America finally solved
summary: Originating in the Upper Amazon over 5,000 years ago, cocoa cultivation spread rapidly from pre-Columbian civilizations to the Pacific coast of South America.

title: Haiti extends state of emergency, closes main port; Blinken presses PM for 'urgent' transition
summary: The Haitian capital is also under a nighttime curfew to try to foster peace, but the gangs are often better armed than the country's security forces.

title: US army intelligence analyst charged with selling military information to China
summary: Sergeant Korbein Schultz comes shortly after the arrests in California of two US Navy sailors on charges of spying for China.

title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba: 'Time for Europe and the US to answer questions posed at Paris summit'
summary: The Ukrainian foreign minister argues that if Europe is to restore peace, it must increase its arms production and ban exports of artillery ammunition to other continents.

title: Israel-Hamas war: UN investigation confirms "sexual violence" in October 7 attack
summary: Following a mission lasting just over two weeks, the UN team found 'reasonable grounds to believe' that 'rape and gang rape' took place during the attack on October 7, 2023, while acknowledging the limitations of its own investigation.

title: Ukraine's ex-army chief Zaluzhny appointed ambassador to UK
summary: The announcement comes a month after Valery Zaluzhny was removed from his position as the country's commander-in-chief.

title: Red Bull suspends woman who accused boss Horner of inappropriate behavior
summary: The woman's suspension was directly related to the Forluma 1 team's investigation, which is now closed.

title: Gaza health crisis: 'You can't feed two million people with airdrops'
summary: Fabrizio Carboni, ICRC regional director for the Middle East, calls for a 'de-escalation' of hostilities in the Gaza Strip and for the principles of humanitarian law to be respected to respond to a crisis of unprecedented proportions.

title: Macron states 'unwavering support' for Moldova in face of Russian menace
summary: Moldovan President Maia Sandu made a visit to Paris to sign a bilateral defense deal with France.

title: Ursula von der Leyen backed by EPP for second term as European Commission chief
summary: Von der Leyen, 65, announced her candidacy for a second term as president of the European Commission in February, and her endorsement by the conservative European People's Party places her firmly as a frontrunner for this position at the head of the EU.

title: 'America is back': Joe Biden's glowing economic record
summary: As he delivers his State of the Union address on Thursday, the president of the United States can boast of a very low unemployment rate and controlled inflation, six months ahead of the presidential election.

title: France's Assemblée Nationale approves bill to rehabilitate people convicted of homosexuality
summary: The bill aims to recognize and compensate for the harm suffered by homosexual people as a result of discriminatory laws in force between 1942 and 1982.

title: Paris 2024: Union threatens to strike, filing notices covering duration of Olympics
summary: Strike notices for public sector workers will be filed by the CGT union, in what is a first step toward potential strikes. An earlier notice was filed for Paris transport workers.

title: More than 230 million individuals worldwide have survived female genital mutilation
summary: Progress needs to increase to 27 times the current level to eradicate the practice by 2030, as called for in the UN's Agenda for Sustainable Development.

title: Fifth mass coral bleaching event in eight years underway on Australia's Great Barrier Reef
summary: When water temperatures rise excessively, corals will expel the algae (zooxanthellae) residing in their tissues, resulting in the coral turning completely white. While corals can endure a bleaching event, they experience heightened stress levels and face increased mortality risks.

title: Biden attacks Trump in fiery speech, warns US democracy at risk in State of Union address
summary: American President Joe Biden turned his State of the Union speech Thursday, March 7, into an animated argument for a second term as he laced into GOP front-runner Donald Trump for espousing "resentment, revenge and retribution" and jeopardizing freedom at home and abroad.

title: Housing crisis: In Portugal, near Lisbon, precarious workers are living in makeshift camps
summary: Faced with soaring rents in the Portuguese capital overrun by tourists, an increasing number of employees and workers, often foreigners holding low-wage jobs, are settling in tents on the outskirts of the city.

title: Biden's electoral weapon against Trump: Abortion rights
summary: Kate Cox, a woman who was a victim of some Republican states' restrictions on access to abortion is one of the guests of honor at Joe Biden's State of the Union address this Thursday.
